rounds.title: Clue Phase
rounds.rule1: Starting with the first player, everyone gives <1>ONE</1> clue.
rounds.rule3: Be subtle! Don't give away the word, but don't be too vague.

impostorGuess.chance: But they have a chance to guess the secret word!

concept.title: 1. The Concept
concept.text: All players receive the same secret word, except ONE player: the <1>IMPOSTOR</1>.

clues.title: 2. Clues
clues.text: In each round, each player must say a single word or short phrase related to the secret word.
clues.tip: üí° <1>Tip:</1> Don't be too obvious (the impostor will find out), nor too vague (they'll think you're the impostor).

vote.title: 3. Single Vote
vote.text: After the discussion, the group must vote for ONE person.
vote.li1: If you vote for the <1>IMPOSTOR</1>, the Citizens win! (But watch out...)
vote.li2: If you vote for an <1>INNOCENT</1>, the Impostor wins immediately!

lastChance.title: 4. Last Chance
lastChance.text: If the Impostor is discovered, they have one <1>last chance</1>: if they guess the secret word, they steal the victory from the Citizens!

undercover.title: üïµÔ∏è Undercover
undercover.text: Replaces the Impostor. They receive a word <1>very similar</1> to the citizens', making them much harder to detect.

confused.text: An <1>additional</1> role. Receives a similar word, but is innocent! Plays with the citizens.
